abstract: In this week's Complaint Box: New York's flea markets reflect the mistaken notion that all items increase in value as they wear, age and decompose.
snippet: In this week's Complaint Box: New York's flea markets reflect the mistaken notion that all items increase in value as they wear, age and decompose.
lead_paragraph: Whenever my wife and I visit our local flea market, the ever-more-popular Brooklyn Flea in Fort Greene, I inevitably end up being amazed, then irritated, at what I see.

headline.main: Complaint Box | Fleecing at the Flea
